BRD-1.content:
Develop a fully offline-capable, high-performance, real-time Python AI assistant framework (MAGGIE).
It **must** integrate modular “Services” for local LLM inference, Text-to-Speech (TTS), Speech-to-Text (STT), and Wake Word Detection (WWD).
It **must** implement a modular event loop, “Routines” for task-specific application functionality, and provide extension via “Services”, “Tools”, and “Routines”.
BRD-1.title: Project Purpose

BRD-2.content:
Enable responsive, privacy-preserving AI assistant capabilities without dependency on cloud infrastructure.
The system **must** ensure fault tolerance, maintainability, and deterministic state transitions via an HSM.
BRD-2.title: Strategic Objective

BRD-3.1.title: **Privacy & Offline:** Enable operation without internet dependency or data leakage.

BRD-3.2.title: **Customizability:** Allow extension via a modular architecture.

BRD-3.3.title: **Performance:** Leverage local GPU resources for low-latency performance.

BRD-3.5.title: **Observability:** Enhance debugging via distributed, correlated logging.

BRD-4.content:
Users require AI assistant capabilities but are constrained by internet dependency, privacy concerns, and the limitations of single-process applications.
The framework requires a high-performance, non-blocking, and fault-isolating Inter-Process Communication (IPC) architecture.

System Scope
BRD-4.title: Problem Statement

BRD-5.2.title: Local LLM, TTS, and STT inference.

BRD-5.5.title: Intuitive UI for control and state feedback.

BRD-6.2.title: **Operation:** Real-time operation with limited blocking tolerance.

BRD-7.1.title: **Primary:** End users requiring offline AI assistant functionality.

BRD-9.1.title: Persistent HSM state for crash recovery.

BRD-9.4.title: Metrics dashboard with live state visualization.

FSD-1.content: The system must maintain independent but interconnected processes utilizing a multi-process architecture:
FSD-1.title: Process Orchestration

FSD-1.1.content:
Routes request-response messages between services and tracks in-flight requests via `request_id`.

**Services (Spokes):**
FSD-1.1.title: Core Hub

FSD-1.3.title: **Runtime Process:** GPU-optimized environment for model inference.

FSD-1.4.title: **Audio Process:** Real-time audio I/O, WWD, and VAD.

FSD-2.1.title: Core must maintain an HSM (using `transitions` library).

FSD-2.2.title: **Dynamic Compilation:** HSM must be dynamically compiled at startup from definitions provided by Tools, Routines, and Services.

FSD-2.4.content:
- `sleeping` (Start): Low power, UI Dark, Input Locked.
- `waking`: Triggered by `WAKE_WORD` or `GUI_INTERACTION`.
- `active`: Normal operation, UI Bright, Input Unlocked.
FSD-2.4.title: **Transitions:**

FSD-3.1.title: **Tools:** Modular functional assets with specific HSM states (e.g., File Export).

FSD-3.2.title: **Routines:** Structured workflows composed of Tools and Services (e.g., Recipe Creator).

FSD-3.3.title: **Default Routine:** A "Primary Routine" providing conversational LLM chat mapping GUI inputs to CLI commands.

FSD-4.2.title: **Constraint:** Must only send `WAKE_WORD_DETECTED` if Core is in `idle` state.

FSD-4.4.title: **VAD (Stage 2):** Neural VAD (Silero via ONNX Runtime CPU) runs locally in Audio Process. Refines |FSD-4.3| output.

FSD-4.5.title: **Signal Output:** Emits normalized `SIGNAL_SPEECH` (Text) or `SIGNAL_WAKE` (Event) to Core. No command interpretation.

FSD-5.1.title: **STT:** Execute transcription using `faster-whisper` (ONNX) on audio buffers routed from Audio Service.

FSD-5.2.title: **LLM:** Execute text generation using local models via ONNX Runtime.

FSD-5.4.title: **Error Handling:** Must report clear error codes (e.g., `ONNX_E_CUDA_OOM`).

FSD-6.1.title: All processes must emit logs to the central LogServer.

FSD-6.2.title: **Fire-and-Forget:** Senders must never block; messages are dropped if LogServer is down.

FSD-6.3.title: **Correlation:** All logs must include `request_id` for correlation across processes.

FSD-7.1.title: **LogServer Fault:** Senders continue normally, silently dropping logs.

FSD-7.2.title: **Service Fault:** Core detects disconnection, marks service unavailable, transitions requests to error.

FSD-7.3.title: **Timeout:** Core detects non-response (>5.0s) and triggers error state.

FSD-7.4.title: **Core Fault:** Services remain operational but disconnected; attempt reconnect on restart.

FSD-8.1.title: **Input Normalization:** Core accepts inputs (`VOICE`, `CLI`, `GUI`) as uniform text strings.

FSD-8.2.title: **Command Registry:** Core maintains a registry of valid commands mapping "String" → "Callable".

FSD-8.3.title: **Fast Path:** IF input matches Registry Key → Execute immediately (Deterministic).

FSD-8.4.title: **Slow Path:** IF input does not match → Forward to LLM Service for inference (Probabilistic).

FSD-9.1.title: **State Reflection:** UI must visually reflect state (Dark/Gray for Sleep, Bright/Color for Active).

FSD-9.2.title: **Input Locking:** Text input disabled in Sleep; Blinking cursor only in Active.

FSD-9.3.title: **Wake Triggers:** System wakes on Voice ("Hey Maggie") OR Click-to-Wake on input box.

FSD-9.4.content:
- *Sleep -> Waking (Click):* Play "Yes? Just one moment, please."
- *Waking -> Active:* Play "How can I assist you."
FSD-9.4.title: **Audio Feedback:**

ICD-1.content:
.. code-block:: yaml

   core:
     router_bind: "tcp://127.0.0.1:5555"
     push_connect: "tcp://127.0.0.1:5556"    # Added for Core logging
     router_hwm: 1000
     queue_maxsize: 1000
     poll_timeout_ms: 100
     response_timeout_s: 5.0
     extensions:
       path: "./extensions"      # Root for tools/routines discovery

   logserver:
     pull_bind: "tcp://127.0.0.1:5556"
     poll_timeout_ms: 1      # Tight loop for high throughput
     log_rotation_mb: 50
     log_retention_days: 30

   services:
     ui:
       dealer_connect: "tcp://127.0.0.1:5555"
       push_connect: "tcp://127.0.0.1:5556"
       queue_maxsize: 100
       poll_timeout_ms: 100
     runtime:
       dealer_connect: "tcp://127.0.0.1:5555"
       push_connect: "tcp://127.0.0.1:5556"
       queue_maxsize: 50
       poll_timeout_ms: 100
     audio:
       dealer_connect: "tcp://127.0.0.1:5555"
       push_connect: "tcp://127.0.0.1:5556"
       queue_maxsize: 50
       poll_timeout_ms: 10

Message Protocols
ICD-1.title: IPC Configuration (ipc_config.yaml)

ICD-3.content:
Every IPC message frame 0 (Metadata) must validate against:

.. code-block:: json

   {
     "source": "UI | Audio | Runtime | Core",
     "destination": "Target_Service_Name",
     "command": "function_name_or_signal",
     "request_id": "uuid-v4-string",
     "timestamp": "ISO-8601-string",
     "priority": 1,
     "payload_type": "json | binary | text"
   }

Note: Priority 0 = High, 1 = Normal
ICD-3.title: Metadata Schema (JSON)

ISP-1.4.content:
.. code-block:: python

   import zmq
   import yaml
   import queue
   import itertools
   import threading
   from transitions import Machine

   class CoreProcess:
       """
       Orchestrates IPC between services using ZeroMQ ROUTER pattern.
       """
       def __init__(self, config_path: str):
           """
           Initialize ZMQ Context, Bind ROUTER.
           Init self.active_requests = {} (ID -> Identity, Ts, Cmd).
           Init self.queue = PriorityQueue(maxsize).
           Init self.counter = itertools.count().
           """
           pass

       def _start_receiver_thread(self) -> None:
           """
           Spawns a daemon thread running a ZMQ Poller.
           Parse: [client_identity, b'', metadata, payload...]
           Put (priority, next(counter), (client_identity, frames)) into queue.
           """
           pass

       def run(self) -> None:
           """
           Main Event Loop.
           1. Process self.queue (Priority).
           2. Check timeouts in self.active_requests (>5.0s).
           3. Drive HSM transitions (enter_processing, enter_error).
           """
           pass
ISP-1.4.title: **HSM:** Setup `transitions.Machine` with states from `FSD-2`.

ISP-2.3.content:
.. code-block:: python

   class ServiceClient:
       """
       Standard client for Service processes.
       Maintains DEALER (Command) and PUSH (Log) sockets.
       """
       def __init__(self, service_name: str, config_path: str):
           """
           Connects DEALER and PUSH sockets based on ICD-1.
           Sets PUSH socket to SNDHWM=1, LINGER=0 (Fire-and-Forget).
           Starts receiver thread.
           """
           pass

       def send_request(self, command: str, payload: dict, priority: int = 1) -> None:
           """
           Constructs metadata (ICD-3) and sends via DEALER.
           """
           pass

       def send_log(self, level: str, message: str, request_id: str = None) -> None:
           """
           Fire-and-forget log emission.
           Constructs frame: [Metadata(ICD-3), Message].
           Must swallow zmq.Again exceptions.
           """
           pass
ISP-2.3.title: **Threading:** Implement `_receiver_thread` to populate internal `PriorityQueue`.

ISP-3.2.title: **Performance:** Use 1ms poll timeout for high throughput.

ISP-3.3.content:
.. code-block:: python

   from loguru import logger

   class LogServerSink:
       """
       Aggregates logs from all services via PULL socket.
       """
       def __init__(self, config_path: str):
           """
           Bind PULL socket.
           Configure Loguru (Rotation: 50MB, Retention: 30 Days).
           """
           pass

       def run(self) -> None:
           """
           Tight Poll Loop (1ms).
           Parse [metadata, message] -> logger.log().
           """
           pass
ISP-3.3.title: **Storage:** Configure `loguru` rotation/retention policies.

ISP-4.2.title: **Contract:** Enforce `initialize`, `get_hsm_states`, and `handle_event`.

ISP-5.1.title: **Logic:** Implement Wake Word -> VAD -> STT pipeline.

ISP-5.2.content:
.. code-block:: python

   def audio_worker_loop(client: ServiceClient):
       """
       Real-time audio processing loop.
       """
       # Setup pvporcupine (Wake Word) and webrtcvad (VAD)

       while True:
           # 1. Read Audio Chunk
           # 2. Denoise
           # 3. Check Wake Word -> client.send_request("WAKE_WORD") IF Core is IDLE
           # 4. Check VAD -> Buffer for STT
           # 5. Handle inbound IPC messages (client.poll_queue)
           pass
ISP-5.2.title: **Constraint:** Check Core State (`idle`) before sending Wake Word events.

NFR-2.1.title: All communication limited to local TCP sockets (`127.0.0.1`) via ZeroMQ.

NFR-2.2.title: No cloud dependencies allowed for runtime operations.

NFR-3.1.title: **CPU Idle:** Processes polling for IPC messages must consume <5% CPU when idle.

NFR-3.2.title: **Audio Priority:** CPU-bound services (Audio) must prioritize low-latency over idle CPU.

NFR-5.1.title: **Non-blocking:** No process shall block waiting for another during standard IPC.

NFR-5.2.title: **Isolation:** Failures in UI, Runtime, or Audio must not cascade to Core.

NFR-5.3.title: **Fire-and-Forget:** Log messages are acceptable to be lost if LogServer is down.

NFR-5.4.title: **Timeout Accuracy:** Detection must be within ±100ms of configured limit.

NFR-5.5.title: **Core Failure:** In-flight requests are considered lost (MVP acceptable).

NFR-5.6.title: **Message Routability:** The Core must explicitly detect and handle attempts to send messages to disconnected or non-existent service identities.

SAD-1.1.title: **Hub-and-Spoke:** Core Process acts as the central `ROUTER` (Hub); Services are `DEALER` (Spokes).

SAD-1.2.title: **Decoupled Sink:** Dedicated LogServer acts as `PULL` sink for `PUSH` sources.

SAD-1.3.title: **No Shared Abstraction:** `ROUTER-DEALER` and `PUSH-PULL` patterns are implemented separately to avoid artificial coupling.

SAD-1.4.title: **Context Propagation:** `request_id` must be passed in every frame.

SAD-2.content:
.. mermaid::

   graph LR
      subgraph Services ["External Services (DEALER)"]
         direction TB
         UI["UI"]
         Runtime["Runtime"]
         Audio["Audio"]
      end

      Core["Core Process (ROUTER)"]
      LogServer["LogServer (PULL)"]

      %% Bidirectional Request-Response (ROUTER-DEALER)
      %% Using explicit links for clarity in LR, Core is the Hub
      UI <==> Core
      Runtime <==> Core
      Audio <==> Core

      %% Unidirectional Fire-and-Forget (PUSH-PULL)
      %% Dotted lines for logging
      UI -. PUSH .-> LogServer
      Runtime -. PUSH .-> LogServer
      Audio -. PUSH .-> LogServer
      Core -. PUSH .-> LogServer

      %% Styling
      classDef core fill:#e1f5fe,stroke:#0277bd,stroke-width:2px,rx:5,ry:5;
      classDef service fill:#fff3e0,stroke:#ef6c00,stroke-width:2px,rx:5,ry:5;
      classDef sink fill:#e8f5e9,stroke:#2e7d32,stroke-width:2px,rx:5,ry:5;

      class Core core;
      class UI,Runtime,Audio service;
      class LogServer sink;

      %% Curve smoothing
      linkStyle default interpolate basis
SAD-2.title: Process Topology

SAD-3.4.title: **Requirement:** Core maintains routing table (client identity → socket identity).

SAD-3.8.title: **Requirement:** Senders must set `SNDHWM=100` and `LINGER=0` to buffer micro-bursts without blocking.

SAD-4.1.title: **Receiver Threads:** Each process uses a dedicated thread to poll ZMQ sockets and push to an internal `queue.PriorityQueue`.

SAD-4.2.title: **Main Loop:** The main application loop processes the `PriorityQueue` to remain non-blocking.

SAD-4.6.title: **Ordering:** Monotonic counter (`itertools.count`) ensures FIFO within priority levels.

SAD-5.1.title: All IPC endpoints (addresses, ports) and parameters (queue sizes, timeouts) must be loaded from `ipc_config.yaml`.

TDD-1.10.title: Connect `PUSH` socket to `core.push_connect` (SNDHWM=1, LINGER=0) for logging.

TDD-1.11.title: **Scan Logic:** On startup, iterate directories in `config.core.extensions.path`.

TDD-1.13.title: **Loading:** Use `importlib` to dynamically import the module specified in manifest `entry_point`.

TDD-1.15.title: **Logic:** `resolve_intent(input_str: str)` checks registry before HSM dispatch.

TDD-1.3.title: Bind `ROUTER` socket to address defined in `ipc_config.yaml` (`core.router_bind`).

TDD-1.5.title: Initialize `active_requests` dictionary: `Dict[str, Tuple[bytes, float, str]]` (ID → Identity, Timestamp, Command).

TDD-1.6.title: Initialize HSM using `transitions.Machine`. State definitions include both statically-defined core states and dynamically-compiled states from Tool/Routine extensions.

TDD-1.7.title: **Receiver Thread:** Spawns a `threading.Thread` to poll the `ROUTER` socket and push frames to `self.queue`.

TDD-1.8.title: **Event Loop:** Pops items from `self.queue` (PriorityQueue) and dispatches to HSM triggers.

TDD-1.9.title: **Timeout Monitor:** On every loop iteration, check `active_requests` for timestamps exceeding `response_timeout_s`.

TDD-2.2.title: **Purpose:** Standardized base implementation for UI, Runtime, and Audio services.

TDD-2.4.title: `DEALER`: Connects to Core `ROUTER`. Identity is auto-assigned by ZMQ.

TDD-2.5.title: `PUSH`: Connects to LogServer `PULL`. Must set `SNDHWM=1` and `LINGER=0` (Fire-and-Forget).

TDD-2.7.title: Ordering enforced via `(priority, itertools.count(), message)` tuple.

TDD-2.8.title: **State Awareness:** Must subscribe to HSM state changes and apply CSS classes (`sleeping`, `active`).

TDD-2.9.title: **Input Control:** Widget `setReadOnly(True)` in Sleep; `installEventFilter` to catch Click-to-Wake events.

TDD-3.3.title: Bind `PULL` socket to address defined in `ipc_config.yaml` (`logserver.pull_bind`).

TDD-3.4.title: Execute tight poll loop (1ms timeout) to maximize throughput.

TDD-4.3.title: `get_hsm_states() -> List[Dict]`: Return state definitions for dynamic compilation.

TDD-4.4.title: `handle_event(event_data: Dict) -> str`: Process business logic and return next trigger.

TDD-4.6.content:
- `name`: Unique identifier (string).
 - `version`: Semantic version (string).
 - `type`: "tool" | "routine".
 - `entry_point`: Relative path to python module definition (e.g., "src.plugin").
TDD-4.6.title: **Schema:**

TERM-AUDIO-PROCESS.content: A specialized Runtime Process dedicated to audio capture, processing, or playback.
TERM-AUDIO-PROCESS.title: Audio Process

TERM-CORE-PROCESS.content: The central orchestrator of the Maggie system. Responsible for lifecycle management, message routing, and service coordination. Never referred to as "Manager" or "Host".
TERM-CORE-PROCESS.title: Core Process

TERM-HSM.content: Hierarchical State Machine. The primary architectural pattern for managing complex system states.
TERM-HSM.title: HSM

TERM-LOGSERVER.content: The centralized logging service that aggregates and persists system logs from all processes.
TERM-LOGSERVER.title: LogServer

TERM-ROUTINE.content: A predefined sequence of Tool invocations or logic steps designed to achieve a higher-level goal.
TERM-ROUTINE.title: Routine

TERM-RUNTIME-PROCESS.content: A generic term for any independent operating system process spawned or managed by the Core Process.
TERM-RUNTIME-PROCESS.title: Runtime Process

TERM-SERVICE.content: A long-running, addressable component providing specific functionality (e.g., LogServer, CommandDispatcher).
TERM-SERVICE.title: Service

TERM-TOOL.content: A discrete, executable unit of logic that can be invoked by an agent or the Core Process to perform a specific task.
TERM-TOOL.title: Tool

TERM-UI-PROCESS.content: A specialized Runtime Process dedicated to rendering the graphical user interface.
TERM-UI-PROCESS.title: UI Process

arch.description: Mapping of uml key to uml content.

constraints.description: List of constraint names, which are defined for this need.

constraints_error.description: An error message set if any constraint failed, and `error_message` field is set in config.

constraints_passed.description: True if all constraints passed, False if any failed, None if not yet checked.

constraints_results.description: Mapping of constraint name, to check name, to result, None if not yet checked.

content.description: The main content of the need.

docname.description: Name of the document where the need is defined (None if external).

doctype.description: The markup type of the content, denoted by the suffix of the source file, e.g. '.rst'.

external_css.description: CSS class name, added to the external reference.

external_url.description: URL of the need, if it is an external need.

has_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list.

has_forbidden_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list, and the link type does not allow dead links.

is_external.description: If true, no node is created and need is referencing external url.

is_import.description: If true, the need was derived from an import.

is_modified.description: Whether the need was modified by needextend.

jinja_content.description: Whether the content was pre-processed by jinja.

layout.description: Key of the layout, which is used to render the need.

lineno.description: Line number where the need is defined (None if external).

parts.description: Mapping of parts, a.k.a. sub-needs, IDs to data that overrides the need's data

post_template.description: The template key, if the post_content was created from a jinja template.

pre_template.description: The template key, if the pre_content was created from a jinja template.

signature.description: Derived from a docutils desc_name node.

style.description: Comma-separated list of CSS classes (all appended by `needs_style_`).

template.description: The template key, if the content was created from a jinja template.
